name: Idiopathic Tracheobronchial Amyloidosis
chief_complaint: I can't stop coughing and feel like I'm choking when I lie down
treatment: localized tracheal resection with end-to-end anastomosis
systemic chemotherapy for underlying plasma cell dyscrasia
prognosis: Guarded - progressive disease often requires repeated interventions with 5-year survival of 60-70%
description: A rare form of localized amyloid deposition in tracheobronchial tree causing progressive airway obstruction. Characterized by extracellular deposition of misfolded immunoglobulin light chain proteins forming Î²-pleated sheets that disrupt normal tissue architecture.
